alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 20 at 8:56PM CDT until July 25 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau affecting Bienville, Red River, Bossier and Webster Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat At Lake Bistineau. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 142.5 feet, Expect some minor flooding of low area camps, however, all access roadways will remain open. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 142.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Thursday was 142.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 142.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 142.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 142.9 feet on 01/08/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday evening at 900 PM CDT.
